The Intelligence Age: A New Milestone for Humanity in Just a Few Years?

(That’s years, not decades!)

Kenji

40

Sam Altman’s latest blog, The Intelligence Age, got me thinking about where we’re headed. Just like the Industrial, Agricultural, and Information Ages profoundly shaped society, Altman sees AI as the next giant leap. He’s calling this the Intelligence Age, and it’s easy to see why.

His Bold Predictions:

How does he get to this bold prediction? It’s simple, in his own 15 words:

“In 15 words: deep learning worked, got predictably better with scale, and we dedicated increasing resources to it.”

“In 15 words: deep learning worked, got predictably better with scale, and we dedicated increasing resources to it.”

What About the Long-Term?

While all the short-term hype is exciting, the long-term effects of AI could be even bigger than we think. History shows us that we usually underestimate the impact of major technological revolutions, and this one might be no different.

What’s Next for Jobs?

💼 Job Changes Are Coming: Sure, some roles might disappear, but AI will also create new types of work — jobs we can’t even imagine today. As in the past, technology is going to push us to be more creative, productive, and innovative.

So, what do you think? Is your industry ready for the Intelligence Age? Let’s talk.
